name: cluster.name
description: The name of the CrateDB cluster the node should join to.
label: others

name: node.name
description: The name of the node. If no name is configured a random one will be generated.
label: others

name: node.max_local_storage_nodes
description: Defines how many nodes are allowed to be started on the same machine using the same configured data path
label: performance

name: node.data
description: Whether or not this node will store data.
label: manageability

name: node.sql.read_only
description: If set to true, the node will only allow SQL statements which are resulting in read operations.
label: security

name: http.port
description: This defines the TCP port range to which the CrateDB HTTP service will be bound to.
label: environment

name: http.publish_port
description: The port HTTP clients should use to communicate with the node.
label: environment

name: transport.tcp.port
description: This defines the TCP port range to which the CrateDB transport service will be bound to.
label: environment

name: transport.publish_port
description: The port that the node publishes to the cluster for its own discovery.
label: environment

name: psql.port
description: This defines the TCP port range to which the CrateDB Postgres service will be bound to.
label: environment

name: path.conf
description: Filesystem path to the directory containing the configuration files crate.yml and log4j2.properties.
label: environment

name: path.data
description: Filesystem path to the directory where this CrateDB node stores its data (table data and cluster metadata).
label: environment

name: path.logs
description: Filesystem path to a directory where log files should be stored.
label: environment

name: path.repo
description: A list of filesystem or UNC paths where repositories of type fs may be stored.
label: environment

name: bootstrap.memory_lock
description: CrateDB performs poorly when the JVM starts swapping: you should ensure that it never swaps. If set to true, CrateDB will use the mlockall system call on startup to ensure that the memory pages of the CrateDB process are locked into RAM.
label: performance

name: auth.trust.http_default_user
description: The default user that should be used for authentication when clients connect to CrateDB via HTTP protocol and they do not specify a user via the Authorization request header.
label: security

name: auth.host_based.enabled
description: Setting to enable or disable Host Based Authentication (HBA). It is disabled by default.
label: security

name: ssl.http.enabled
description: Set this to true to enable secure communication between the CrateDB node and the client through SSL via the HTTPS protocol.
label: security

name: ssl.psql.enabled
description: Set this to true to enable secure communication between the CrateDB node and the client through SSL via the PostgreSQL wire protocol.
label: security

name: ssl.ingestion.mqtt.enabled
description: Set this to true to enable secure communication between the CrateDB node and the client through SSL via the MQTT protocol.
label: security

name: ssl.keystore_filepath
description: The full path to the node keystore file.
label: environment

name: ssl.keystore_password
description: The password used to decrypt the keystore file defined with ssl.keystore_filepath.
label: security

name: ssl.truststore_filepath
description: The full path to the node truststore file. If not defined, then only a keystore will be used.
label: environment

name: ssl.truststore_password
description: The password used to decrypt the truststore file defined with ssl.truststore_filepath.
label: security

name: http.cors.enabled
description: Enable or disable cross-origin resource sharing.
label: environment

name: http.cors.max-age
description: Max cache age of a preflight request in seconds.
label: reliability

name: blobs.path
description: Path to a filesystem directory where to store blob data allocated for this node.
label: environment

name: repositories.url.allowed_urls
description: This setting is a security measure to prevent access to arbitrary resources.
label: security

name: indices.query.bool.max_clause_count
description: This setting defines the maximum number of elements an array can have so that the != ANY(), LIKE ANY() and the NOT LIKE ANY() operators can be applied on it.
label: performance

name: ingestion.mqtt.enabled
description: Enables the MQTT ingestion source on this node.
label: environment

name: ingestion.mqtt.port
description: TCP port on which the endpoint is exposed.
label: environment

name: ingestion.mqtt.timeout
description: The default keep-alive timeout for establised connections.
label: reliability

name: stats.enabled
description: A boolean indicating whether or not to collect statistical information about the cluster.
label: manageability

name: stats.jobs_log_size
description: The maximum number of job records kept to be kept in the sys.jobs_log table on each node. These records are used for performance analytics. A larger job log produces more comprehensive stats, but uses more RAM.
label: performance

name: stats.jobs_log_expiration
description: The job record expiry time in seconds.
label: reliability

name: stats.jobs_log_filter
description: An expression to determine if a job should be recorded into sys.jobs_log. The expression must evaluate to a boolean.
label: manageability

name: stats.jobs_log_persistent_filter
description: An expression to determine if a job should also be recorded to the regular CrateDB log.
label: manageability

name: stats.operations_log_size
description: The maximum number of operations records to be kept in the sys.operations_log table on each node. Operations records are used for performance analytics. A larger operations log produces more comprehensive stats, but uses more RAM.
label: performance

name: stats.operations_log_expiration
description: Entries of sys.operations_log are cleared by a periodically job when they are older than the specified expire time.
label: reliability

name: stats.service.interval
description: Defines the refresh interval to refresh tables statistics used to produce optimal query execution plans.
label: performance

name: cluster.graceful_stop.timeout
description: Defines the maximum waiting time in milliseconds for the reallocation process to finish. The force setting will define the behaviour when the shutdown process runs into this timeout.
label: reliability

name: cluster.graceful_stop.force
description: Defines whether graceful stop should force stopping of the node if it runs into the timeout which is specified with the cluster.graceful_stop.timeout setting.
label: reliability

name: bulk.request_timeout
description: Defines the timeout of internal shard-based requests involved in the execution of SQL DML Statements over a huge amount of rows.
label: reliability

name: discovery.zen.ping_interval
description: How often to ping other nodes. Nodes must remain responsive to pings or they will be marked as failed and removed from the cluster.
label: reliability

name: discovery.zen.ping_timeout
description: The time to wait for ping responses from other nodes when discovering. Set this option to a higher value on a slow or congested network to minimize discovery failures.
label: reliability

name: discovery.zen.ping_retries
description: How many ping failures (network timeouts) indicate that a node has failed.
label: reliability

name: discovery.zen.publish_timeout
description: Time a node is waiting for responses from other nodes to a published cluster state.
label: reliability

name: discovery.ec2.groups
description: A list of security groups; either by ID or name. Only instances with the given group will be used for unicast host discovery.
label: security

name: discovery.ec2.any_group
description: Defines whether all (false) or just any (true) security group must be present for the instance to be used for discovery.
label: security

name: discovery.ec2.host_type
description: Defines via which host type to communicate with other instances.
label: environment

name: discovery.ec2.availability_zones
description: A list of availability zones. Only instances within the given availability zone will be used for unicast host discovery.
label: environment

name: cloud.azure.management.resourcegroup.name
description: The name of the resource group the CrateDB cluster is running on.
label: others

name: cluster.routing.allocation.allow_rebalance
description: Allow to control when rebalancing will happen based on the total state of all the indices shards in the cluster.
label: performance

name: cluster.routing.allocation.cluster_concurrent_rebalance
description: Define how many concurrent rebalancing tasks are allowed cluster wide.
label: performance

name: cluster.routing.allocation.node_initial_primaries_recoveries
description: Define the number of initial recoveries of primaries that are allowed per node. Since most times local gateway is used, those should be fast and we can handle more of those per node without creating load.
label: reliability

name: cluster.routing.allocation.node_concurrent_recoveries
description: How many concurrent recoveries are allowed to happen on a node.
label: performance

name: cluster.routing.allocation.balance.shard
description: Defines the weight factor for shards allocated on a node (float). Raising this raises the tendency to equalize the number of shards across all nodes in the cluster.
label: performance

name: cluster.routing.allocation.balance.index
description: Defines a factor to the number of shards per index allocated on a specific node (float). Increasing this value raises the tendency to equalize the number of shards per index across all nodes in the cluster.
label: performance

name: cluster.routing.allocation.balance.threshold
description: Minimal optimization value of operations that should be performed (non negative float). Increasing this value will cause the cluster to be less aggressive about optimising the shard balance.
label: performance

name: cluster.routing.allocation.disk.threshold_enabled
description: Prevent shard allocation on nodes depending of the disk usage.
label: performance

name: indices.recovery.max_bytes_per_sec
description: Specifies the maximum number of bytes that can be transferred during shard recovery per seconds.
label: reliability

name: indices.recovery.retry_delay_state_sync
description: Defines the time to wait after an issue caused by cluster state syncing before retrying to recover.
label: reliability

name: indices.recovery.retry_delay_network
description: Defines the time to wait after an issue caused by the network before retrying to recover.
label: reliability

name: indices.recovery.internal_action_timeout
description: Defines the timeout for internal requests made as part of the recovery.
label: reliability

name: indices.recovery.internal_action_long_timeout
description: Defines the timeout for internal requests made as part of the recovery that are expected to take a long time.
label: reliability

name: indices.recovery.recovery_activity_timeout
description: Recoveries that don't show any activity for more then this interval will fail.
label: reliability

name: cluster.info.update.interval
description: Defines how often the cluster collect metadata information (e.g. disk usages etc.) if no concrete event is triggered.
label: reliability

name: gateway.expected_nodes
description: The setting gateway.expected_nodes defines the number of nodes that should be waited for until the cluster state is recovered immediately.
label: reliability

name: gateway.recover_after_time
description: The gateway.recover_after_time setting defines the time to wait before starting starting the recovery once the number of nodes defined in gateway.recover_after_nodes are started.
label: reliability

name: gateway.recover_after_nodes
description: The gateway.recover_after_nodes setting defines the number of nodes that need to be started before the cluster state recovery will start.
label: reliability
